verdict.summary: FluxCD failed to reconcile the desired state from Git to the Kubernetes cluster. The source controller, kustomize controller, or helm controller could not apply the manifests. Causes include invalid YAML, Helm chart version conflicts, or insufficient RBAC permissions.

dead_ends.action: Deleting and recreating the FluxCD resources without fixing the manifests
dead_ends.why_fails: FluxCD will re-read the same broken manifests from Git and fail again. The issue is in the source, not in FluxCD's state.
Suspending stops GitOps entirely. The cluster drifts from the desired state in Git, defeating the purpose of FluxCD.

workarounds.action: Check FluxCD resource status and fix source manifests
workarounds.how: Run flux get all to see all resource statuses. Check specific failures: flux get kustomizations or flux get helmreleases. Read the status message for the exact error. Fix the YAML/Helm values in Git and push.

workarounds.action: Force reconciliation after fixing the source
workarounds.how: After fixing manifests in Git, trigger immediate reconciliation: flux reconcile source git flux-system && flux reconcile kustomization flux-system. Check logs: flux logs --follow.

leads_to.condition: when FluxCD manages HelmReleases and the underlying Helm upgrade fails

frequently_confused_with.distinction: FluxCD reconciliation uses a push-based controller model; ArgoCD sync uses a pull-based application model. Same GitOps concept, different tools.
